name: Wingate by Wyndham St. George

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here 2 nights as base to explore Zion Nat'l Park. Was about 1-hr drive from Zion, which went quickly. Highly recommend this hotel. Hotel seemed new or newly redone, had popular pool and hot tub area (families used it until quite late, which we could hear from our room, which was only tiny negative thing). Complimentary breakfast included make-yourself waffles (delicious!), yogurt, bagels, cereals, juices, coffees, eggs, sausage. Really good value and good way to kick off your day. Staff was friendly too. Hotel is located almost adjacent to Wal-Mart, which was convenient for stocking up on water, snacks. Business center too with free Internet.
reviews.title: Really nice property and friendly staff

reviews.text: I got a discounted rate but a first class experience. Facilities are top quality and staff were too. I f you need a place on your route away from Vegas give it a go.
reviews.title: Great alternative to other motels

reviews.text: The staff at the Wingate is the one of the best that we have ever encountered. The room was very clean. The bedding and mattresses were great. The pool area was clean and the water was a good temp. The breakfast was above that of other hotels. Scrambled eggs, yogurt, bagels, waffles, a nice variety of juices, etc. The breakfast was on par to a Residence Inn breakfast. We have stayed at Wynhams in the past but never a Wingate. Based on our experience at St. George, we will now search out the Wingates.
reviews.title: Fantastic Staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights while visiting Zion National Park, Bryce Canyon, Lake Powell/Glen Canyon and the North Rim of the Grand Canyon. All were within 3 hours of this hotel, so it made a great "base".
reviews.title: Great place/great price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in is 3:00pm or 4:00pm, but they happily checked us in when we arrived at 10:30am. Room was clean, spacious and quite comfortable.
reviews.title: All around a great place to stay.

reviews.text: Just returned from a quick Thanksgiving weekend trip to St. George. My cousin was getting married and selected the Wingate as the venue for the after party.
reviews.title: Best In St. George

reviews.text: The hotel is very clean and it is rather cozy. The pool area was pleasant and there are two computers with free internet. I worked out in the gym twice and was very happy. The cardio equipment has tv's attached and there was also a large flat screen on the wall.
reviews.title: Best service and hotel we ever experienced!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel room was very clean & modern. There was a large flat television and the beds were comfy. The bathroom features general bath products, but dons a luxurious granite countertop, a ritzy touch. One downside is that we didn't feel there was enough space to hang some of our clothes and swimming suits.
reviews.title: Excellent as always

reviews.text: We were very pleased with the free breakfast. The waffles were great and the buffet also featured two other hot items each day, usually eggs and some meat like sausage or bacon. The eating area is very nice, with plenty of tables and flat screen televisions to keep you entertained if your breakfast conversation becomes dull.
reviews.title: Friendly, comfortable hotel, with great staff

reviews.text: The hotel has a partnership with Basila's Mediterranean Restaurant and therefore they catered the dinner for the event after the wedding ceremony earlier that day. Our group of about 65 was in the Kalahari Room and everything worked out perfectly in my opinion; everything went smoothly, from the set up to clean up. The food was great and the service was first-class. If you are considering a meeting/event venue, I would highly recommend the Wingate.
reviews.title: Very comfortable stay!

reviews.text: I stumbled across St George due to a wrong turn out of Las Vegas. I reserved a room while sipping iced tea at a local Starbucks, got directions and made my way to the hotel. As I walked in the warmth embraced me. Waiting at the front desk for no longer than 90 seconds, I was greeted by an apologetic night manager, Steve. He asked me what brought me in to their facility, and the poor soul didn't expect to hear all the drama that boiled down to a wrong turn onto the 93N Freeway out of Las Vegas, instead of the 95N. He was so sympathetic to me and concerned, I felt his genuine kindness and was immediately reassured my choice to stay here. I was astonished at the beautiful room I was given. It was impressively clean and fresh feeling. Everything was updated, from the linens to the LCD TV's that were mounted on the wall. A more relaxing evening to the end of my stressful day was found in the GIANT jetted bathtub! The hotel has a spa and pool, laundry and business facilities. A lovely choice of breakfast in the morning wrapped up my unexpected stay beautifully. The morning staff was pleasant, although none are parallel with Steve, I thank you!
reviews.title: Remarkable!

reviews.text: I traveled to St. George for a convention. I was not in the mood for travel. Imagine my great surprise when I discovered the Wingate...overall, the best business-travel night I have ever spent!
reviews.title: Easily the best business-travel night ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Please believe me when I say I have traveled for business to every state in the Union. I have tried to put my finger on exactly what made the Wingate so special, but there are actually so many things. The ease of the reservation process; check-in was a total breeze; the room was spacious and comfortable and the breakfast was great. I assure you I will look forward to any future trip to St. George, both business and pleasure!
reviews.title: Excellent Facility, great staff

reviews.text: Spent one night in St George as part our visit to Zion National Park. Clean, neat, well appointed hotel with everything a traveler needs. Beautiful rooms (we were in the very large, comfortable suite), free WiFi, business center, a real exercise room w/ equipment that works, a heated pool, a nice breakfast (included in price). Very convenient to shopping (WalMart next door). The staff was universally friendly, helpful, and welcoming. One criticism - poor signage at roadway "entrance" , awkward traffic circle at highway exit adjacent to hotel.
reviews.title: Horrible Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in town for a conference and was referred to this motel. The front desk manager Steve checked us in and it took 30 minutes. My companion made the reservations with the hotel and assured me it was going to be ok. We showed up 5 minutes after 3 PM and Steve said no rooms were ready. I got the impression that he did not even want to be there talking with us. It seemed as if he didn't even make an effort to help us. This really set my traveling partner off and was the beginning of what ended up being the most horrific hotel stay ever. The swimming pool was freezing with leaves in it and looked to be unsanitary, the breakfast was completely generic, and there never seemed to be any management around to speak with about it. The hotel is understaffed and should be condemned. This will be the last time I stay at any Wyndham Hotel.
reviews.title: Staff and accommodations, where excellence meets quality.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at this hotel were all very friendly and helpful. The hotel which has only been open for 16 months, is very clean and well looked after. We had a one bdrm suite which was very clean and large. The bathroom was large-granite countertop, very nice tiling, with plenty of extra clean towels. Two HD flat screen tv's, microwave, bar fridge, coffee maker, iron/ironing board, night light. There are laundry facilities for guest use. Free Wifi. The complimentary breakfast is excellent, yours to enjoy in the clean, bright lobby area. There is a small pool and hot tub as well as a small court yard. They booked a couple of tee times for us as well. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: A five star stay in St George

reviews.text: This hotel was a pleasant surprise. The decor, rooms and bedding were superb. Our room had a microwave and refrigerator. The breakfast was so good with waffles, bacon, eggs, cereal, fresh fruit, bagels, juices, etc. The staff was extremely accommodating and friendly. The business center and fitness area were open 24/7 and very nice. We've stayed in 4 and 5 star hotels. This one ranks right up there.
reviews.title: Should be rated No. 1 hotel in St. George

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you are traveling to St. George, Utah, do not miss staying at this hotel. The staff is amazing, the rooms are beautiful, and the breakfast is good. These people go out of their way to make you comfortable and happy. This is a brand new hotel and everything is clean and fresh. It is a real value for the money as well. Don't miss out!
reviews.title: A Hidden Gem

reviews.text: We have stayed in this hotel on many occasions and find ourselves looking forward to going back every time. Customer service, friendliness, and cleanliness are top notch. The staff makes it a point to greet us on a first name basis every stay. We're customers for life!
reviews.title: As good as it gets

reviews.text: Unsupervised kids, dirty rooms. I had to ask the desk clerk if the maid would please vacuum the carpet in the room - on day 3 of your stay. Screaming, unsupervised kids running the halls and only one staff person in the place, a young college age gal that was clearly not handling the situation.
reviews.title: Nightmare hotel

aka: Wingate By Wyndham St. George Hotel St. George
description: The Wingate by Wyndham St. George is just 3 years new offering contemporary style with oversized rooms with your choice of one King bed or two Queen beds or our Two Room Suites with a King Bed and sofa bed. Your stay includes a full breakfast with eggs, waffles, fresh fruit, juices, milk, breads, cereal and extras. We are conveniently located for those visiting Zion National Park, Tuacahn Amphitheatre, Dixie State College and Southern Utah activities. Our courtyard and complex area includes a Super Wal-Mart, multiple restaurants, bank, gas stations, dry cleaners and nail salons. We offer airport shuttle to the St. George Airport. All rooms include flat screen TV, High Speed Internet, Microwave, Refrigerator, Coffee Maker, Hair Dryer, In-Room Safe and much more.
